intro: Kedrostis zeyheri, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its striking, spadix-like inflorescence surrounded by a broad, showy spathe. The plant produces edible tubers that are rich in starch and have been used as a food source in various African cultures. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Kedrostis zeyheri is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
